description: System-generated primary key for the physical inventory record.
Human-readable identifier or name for the physical inventory event or count cycle (e.g., a seasonal count name or date).
Free-text description of the physical inventory event, purpose, or scope.
Identifier of the warehouse/location where the count is performed; likely a foreign key to the warehouse master—confirm with SME.
Timestamp when the inventory record was created.
User account that created the inventory record.
Most recent user account to modify the inventory record.
Person(s) who physically counted the items during this inventory.
Numeric sequence used to order inventory batches/lists in the UI or reports; likely a display or processing preference—confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record (application-level). May duplicate last_modified; confirm intended usage with SME.
Additional notes about the inventory count.
System timestamp of the last modification to this record (high precision).
Likely timestamp of last modification (despite the name), mirroring last_modified; field naming appears inconsistent—confirm with SME.
Likely application audit timestamp when a user created the record; may duplicate date_created—confirm with SME.
Likely application audit timestamp of the last user-driven modification; may duplicate date_update/last_modified—confirm with SME.
